intro: Paepalanthus variabilis var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smoothleaf puya, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, inflorescent flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent foliage. Its flowers are often brightly colored, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. This variety is distinguished by its smooth, glabrous leaves, which set it apart from other varieties within the species.
